conclusion: The graph shows velocity (v) in m/s on the y-axis and time (t) in seconds on the x-axis. The distance fallen during any time interval equals the area under the v-t curve during that interval.
At t = 10s, the velocity is 20 m/s, and at t = 15s, the velocity decreases linearly to 10 m/s.

premise: The shape under the curve from t = 10s to t = 15s is a trapezoid with Base 1 = 20 m/s, Base 2 = 10 m/s, and Height = 5 seconds.
conclusion: The formula for the area of a trapezoid is Area = (Base 1 + Base 2) × Height / 2.

premise: Substituting the values into the formula: Base 1 = 20 m/s, Base 2 = 10 m/s, Height = 5 seconds.
The calculated area under the curve from t = 10s to t = 15s is 75 meters.
conclusion: The distance fallen during the 10-15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters.

conclusion: This means the distance is neither greater than nor less than 75 meters - it is equal to 75 meters.
